curam.util.client.domain.render.edit

Class AbstractEditRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      • curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
        • curam.util.client.domain.render.AbstractDomainRenderer
          • curam.util.client.domain.render.edit.AbstractEditRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DomainRenderer, ComponentRenderer<Field>, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn

    public abstract class AbstractEditRenderer
extends AbstractDomainRenderer

    An abstract base class for all renderers that are used to render form controls for the editing or creation of data. Concrete subclasses of this class can be configured as "edit-renderer" plug-ins in the domain configuration. An edit renderer is selected when a field has a target path but does not have an options path.

    Custom edit renderers should extend either this class or another renderer implementation that extends this class. Do not extend the AbstractDomainRenderer class or the attempt to implement directly the DomainRenderer interface.

    If you want to subclass an existing edit renderer to create a view renderer (perhaps the functionality is largely the same), you can do so by overriding the AbstractEditRenderer.getName() method to return the appropriate plug-in name, i.e., "view-renderer". It is the plug-in name that determines whether the renderer can be configured for editing or viewing and not the fact that it is derived from this class or the AbstractViewRenderer class.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the plug-in. This is usually the simple name used to identify the plug-in when loaded. Many different plug-in classes may share the same name if they implement the same type of behavior. For example, "converter" may be used as the name of a plug-in that performs data conversion operations, but there may be different "converter" classes implementing these operations.
        Returns:
        The plug-in name "edit-renderer".

      • registerWithCuramFormsAPI

        protected void registerWithCuramFormsAPI(RendererContext context,
                                         java.lang.String targetID,
                                         java.lang.String targetIDPathField,
                                         java.lang.String adapter)
                                  throws DataAccessException
        Create JS script to register the components for the form events if Autorecovery is supported, which is the case if this is a modal and not an external application.
        Parameters:
        context - RendererContext
        targetID - String field ID.
        targetIDPathField - String field path.
        adapter - String CuramFormsAPI adapter.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - Infrastructure exception.

      • isAutorecoverable

        protected boolean isAutorecoverable(RendererContext context)
        Returns true if this is a context in which we support autorecovery, false otherwise. We also default to false if we cannot determine this is an autorecovery context.

        Autorecover if:

        • CuramFormsAPI is enabled
        • The form being rendered is in a modal.
        • The form being rendered is not in an external application.
        Parameters:
        context - RenderContext
        Returns:
        boolean result.

      • setBTD

        protected void setBTD(org.w3c.dom.Element input,
                      java.lang.String value)
        Invokes base text direction for widgets based on text field.
        Parameters:
        input - the text field.
        value - the initial value of the text field.
